Java provides a rich set of operators to use in manipulating variables. A value used on either side of an operator is called an operand.
For example, in the expression below, the numbers 6 and 3 are operands of the plus operator:@int x = 6 + 3;@it can also be used to add together a variable and a value, or a variable and another variable: @int sum1 = 100 + 50;  // 150 (100 + 50)@int sum2 = sum1 + 250;  // 400 (150 + 250)@int sum3 = sum2 + sum2;  // 800 (400 + 40

Java arithmetic operators:@+ addition
 adds two values together@- subtraction
 subtracts a value from another@*multiplication
 multiplies two values@/ division
 divides one value from another@%modulo
 returns the division remainder@!Arithmetic operators are used in mathematical expressions in the same way that they are used in algebraic equations.
